item.content:encoded:
Reassurance for caregivers to have a safe place for their loved ones, empowering participants to engage in their healthcare and lifting up the spirits of those who are isolated and homebound

Bayview Hunters Point Adult Day Health serves as an extension of care, love, and support to families caring for their loved ones at home.It lifts up the spirits of those who would otherwise be isolated and homebound and it empowers elders and adults living with disabilities and chronic illnesses to stay engaged and remain active members in their community.

Adult Day Health provides:
  • Personal Care Assistance
  • Registered Nurse Assistance
  • Social Work Services
  • Physical Therapy
  • Occupational Therapy
  • Speech Therapy
  • Recreational Activities
  • Nutritious Meals and Nutrition Counseling
  • Psychological Counseling
  • Paratransit Transportation
The Program includes:
  • Dance Parties
  • Dance Competitions
  • Wii Sport Game Competitions
  • Wii Fit Exercise
  • Peer, Family and Caregivers’ Support Groups
  • Arts and Crafts
  • Musical Entertainment
  • Movie Days
  • Birthday and Holiday Celebrations

item.title: Senior Centers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Creating new opportunities to learn and contribute to the community.
item.content:encoded: Organizations like ours are essential to the quality of life in any community. We are deeply engaged with the community’s seniors, and care for them with the dignity, respect and honor they deserve. The agency – which provides safe and welcoming places where seniors find care, companionship, and essential support service – is a lively community focal point, providing elders with nutrition programs, health screenings, rehabilitation services, money management advice, networking opportunities and adult day health care — as well as our nationally recognized senior ex-offender program.

item.title: Senior Ex Offender Program
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: New Address: 1753 Carroll Ave San Francisco, CA 94124
item.content:encoded: The goal of SEOP, to help ex-offenders re-engage in the community, would not be met without first finding housing.  Therefore BHPMSS provides two transitional homes that give ex-offenders a chance to live in the community with support systems.
